snippet: Aid workers acknowledged that humanitarian efforts so far had been insufficient, given the scale of the crisis in Yemen.
abstract: Saudi Arabian-led coalition resumes airstrikes against Houthi rebels in Yemen just hours after expiration of five-day cease-fire; escalation threatens desperate relief effort; remains unclear whether Saudi Arabia will seek renewed truce.

byline.original: By MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Mohammed Ali Kalfood reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Djibouti. David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

lead_paragraph: Aid workers acknowledged that humanitarian efforts so far had been insufficient, given the scale of the crisis in Yemen.

headline.main: Saudi-Led Airstrikes Resume in Yemen as Truce Ends
headline.print_headline: Saudi-Led Airstrikes Resume in Yemen as Truce Ends
